docs.abstract: The company raised $25 million to help it complete orders and was not intended to go toward a proposed purchase of a General Motors plant in Ohio.
docs.snippet: The company raised $25 million to help it complete orders and was not intended to go toward a proposed purchase of a General Motors plant in Ohio.
docs.lead_paragraph: Workhorse, the electric truck maker involved in a proposed deal to acquire an idled General Motors factory in Ohio, said Monday that it had raised $25 million from investors.

headline.main: Electric Truck Company Workhorse Gets Needed Cash Infusion

docs.abstract: Expectations that the Federal Reserve will start dropping interest rates have surged in recent days.
docs.snippet: Expectations that the Federal Reserve will start dropping interest rates have surged in recent days.
docs.lead_paragraph: Traders are betting the Fed will bail them out again. If they’re wrong, things could get ugly.

headline.main: Wall Street Pins Its Hopes on Fed Rate Cuts
headline.print_headline: Stock Investors Are Wagering Fed Will Cut Rates

docs.abstract: Seven Democrats, including the presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren, want the Fed to examine the bank’s compliance with anti-money-laundering laws over flagged transactions.
docs.snippet: Seven Democrats, including the presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren, want the Fed to examine the bank’s compliance with anti-money-laundering laws over flagged transactions.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Democratic senators wants top officials at the Federal Reserve to examine whether Deutsche Bank complied with anti-money-laundering and other laws after bank employees flagged transactions tied to President Trump as potentially suspicious.

headline.main: Senators Ask Federal Reserve to Review Trump’s Deutsche Bank Transactions
headline.print_headline: Review of Trump’s Banking Is Sought

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

docs.abstract: Adam Satariano, who covers technology in Europe, became a frequent user when he moved to London.
docs.snippet: Adam Satariano, who covers technology in Europe, became a frequent user when he moved to London.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Adam Satariano, a technology correspondent based in London, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: Outside the U.S., It’s All About WhatsApp
headline.print_headline: Outside the U.S., It’s All About WhatsApp

docs.abstract: Google said it would acquire Looker for $2.6 billion in a bid to catch rivals in the cloud-computing industry.
docs.snippet: Google said it would acquire Looker for $2.6 billion in a bid to catch rivals in the cloud-computing industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Just as government officials step up their antitrust scrutiny of the American tech giants, Google had a surprising announcement on Thursday: It is buying another company.

headline.main: Google to Buy Data Analytics Company Despite New Antitrust Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Google Buying a Company, Despite Antitrust Scrutiny

docs.abstract: The decision by YouTube, which is owned by Google, is the latest action by a Silicon Valley company to stem the spread of hate speech and disinformation on their sites.
docs.snippet: The decision by YouTube, which is owned by Google, is the latest action by a Silicon Valley company to stem the spread of hate speech and disinformation on their sites.
docs.lead_paragraph: YouTube announced plans on Wednesday to remove thousands of videos and channels that advocate neo-Nazism, white supremacy and other bigoted ideologies in an attempt to clean up extremism and hate speech on its popular service.

headline.main: YouTube to Remove Thousands of Videos Pushing Extreme Views

byline.original: By Kevin Roose and Kate Conger

docs.abstract: Digital recruiting is leaving more of a forensic trail in discrimination cases. But a wave of litigation is running up against higher legal hurdles.
docs.snippet: Digital recruiting is leaving more of a forensic trail in discrimination cases. But a wave of litigation is running up against higher legal hurdles.
docs.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Ala. — Across the United States, mammoth corporations and family businesses share a complaint: a shortage of workers. As the unemployment rate has tunneled its way to a half-century low, employers insist they must scramble to lure applicants.

headline.main: New Evidence of Age Bias in Hiring, and a Push to Fight It
headline.print_headline: Nice Résumé. Wait, You’re How Old?

docs.abstract: “It’s really, really hard to write a 10,000-word cover story,” Jeffrey Goldberg said in an interview about writers who can produce marquee magazine pieces. He said his comments were misconstrued.
docs.snippet: “It’s really, really hard to write a 10,000-word cover story,” Jeffrey Goldberg said in an interview about writers who can produce marquee magazine pieces. He said his comments were misconstrued.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Goldberg, the editor in chief of The Atlantic, set off a storm of criticism Thursday when he suggested that, in seeking a diverse group of writers for cover stories, he had found it difficult to hand those plum assignments to anyone other than white male magazine journalists.

headline.main: Writing Cover Stories Is Hard. For Atlantic Editor, Talking About Diversity Is Harder.
headline.print_headline: Who Gets to Write a 10,000-Word Cover Story?

docs.abstract: Advocates say the state-based accounts, which let disabled people work and save money without risking the loss of government aid, could help millions of people.
docs.snippet: Advocates say the state-based accounts, which let disabled people work and save money without risking the loss of government aid, could help millions of people.
docs.lead_paragraph: New state-based accounts that let disabled people work and save money without risking the loss of government aid are slowly catching on. But advocates say millions more people with disabilities could be taking advantage of the accounts.

headline.main: Savings Accounts for Disabled Americans Catch On, but Slowly
headline.print_headline: A Not-So-Thorny Nest Egg for Disabled People

docs.abstract: A sharp decline in the pace of hiring in May, especially in sectors dependent on trade, suggests that the president’s tariffs are starting to bite.
docs.snippet: A sharp decline in the pace of hiring in May, especially in sectors dependent on trade, suggests that the president’s tariffs are starting to bite.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers, business executives and economists have all tried to warn President Trump that his trade policies could hurt growth. On Friday, the government reported that employers added just 75,000 jobs in May, a fact that will be hard for him to ignore.

headline.main: A Weak Jobs Report Poses a New Challenge to Trump: A Slowing Economy
headline.print_headline: Pace of Hiring Slows to a Crawl As Trade Conflicts Start to Bite
